solution.text:
Substituting the value of \(x=\frac {-1}{_{k}_}\,\) in \(p(x) = _{{k**2}}_x^2 +1\,\), we get,
\(p(\frac{-1}{_{k}_}) = (_{{k**2}}_ \times (\frac{-1}{_{k}_})^2) +1\)
\(\Rightarrow p(\frac{-1}{_{k}_}) = (_{{k**2}}_ \times \frac{1}{_{{k**2}}_}) +1\)
\(\Rightarrow p(\frac{-1}{_{k}_}) = 1+1=2\)
Therefore, \(x=\frac{-1}{_{k}_}\,\) is not a zero of the polynomial \(p(x) = _{{k**2}}_x^2 +1\)
